H0.text: Nonmetals are the second largest class of elements.

H1.text: Carbonates are the second largest class of elements.

H2.text: Silicates are the second largest class of elements.

H3.text: Metalloids are the second largest class of elements.

A4.text: Carbonate minerals are extremely varied and ubiquitous in chemically precipitated sedimentary rock.

A5.text: The term 'carbonate' refers to a functional group within a larger molecule or a mineral containing the carbonate ion, not a class of elements.
